This should be called after copying the module itself into the bitcode file.

### writeModule() {#acedecaa6f87d31e343286c46148e119a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void BitcodeWriter::writeModule (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/module">Module</a> &amp; M, bool ShouldPreserveUseListOrder=false, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/modulesummaryindex">ModuleSummaryIndex</a> &#42; Index=nullptr, bool GenerateHash=false, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a2b53e399f7a71b096a6caef6be6ff12d">ModuleHash</a> &#42; ModHash=nullptr)</>}>
Write the specified module to the buffer specified at construction time.

If <code>ShouldPreserveUseListOrder</code>, encode the use-list order for each <em><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a></em> in <code>M</code>. These will be reconstructed exactly when <em>M</em> is deserialized.

If <code>Index</code> is supplied, the bitcode will contain the summary index (currently for use in ThinLTO optimization).

<code>GenerateHash</code> enables hashing the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/module">Module</a> and including the hash in the bitcode (currently for use in ThinLTO incremental build).

If <code>ModHash</code> is non-null, when GenerateHash is true, the resulting hash is written into ModHash. When GenerateHash is false, that value is used as the hash instead of computing from the generated bitcode. Can be used to produce the same module hash for a minimized bitcode used just for the thin link as in the regular full bitcode that will be used in the backend.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitcode/bitcodewriter-h/#l00089">89</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitcode/bitcodewriter-h">BitcodeWriter.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/bitcode/lib/bitcode/writer/bitcodewriter-cpp/#l05342">5342</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/bitcode/lib/bitcode/writer/bitcodewriter-cpp">BitcodeWriter.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### writeStrtab() {#a8d48eebf776ab619a0174721ddd90872}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void BitcodeWriter::writeStrtab ()">
Write the bitcode file&#39;s string table.

This must be called exactly once after all modules and the optional symbol table have been written.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitcode/bitcodewriter-h/#l00065">65</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitcode/bitcodewriter-h">BitcodeWriter.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/bitcode/lib/bitcode/writer/bitcodewriter-cpp/#l05323">5323</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/bitcode/lib/bitcode/writer/bitcodewriter-cpp">BitcodeWriter.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### writeSymtab() {#aaaca861df948bd93da0afb6891e9d662}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void BitcodeWriter::writeSymtab ()">
Attempt to write a symbol table to the bitcode file.

This must be called at most once after all modules have been written.

A reader does not require a symbol table to interpret a bitcode file; the symbol table is needed only to improve link-time performance. So this function may decide not to write a symbol table. It may so decide if, for example, the target is unregistered or the IR is malformed.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitcode/bitcodewriter-h/#l00061">61</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitcode/bitcodewriter-h">BitcodeWriter.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/bitcode/lib/bitcode/writer/bitcodewriter-cpp/#l05291">5291</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/bitcode/lib/bitcode/writer/bitcodewriter-cpp">BitcodeWriter.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### writeThinLinkBitcode() {#a03f3ffa01b7de15ab90e804ead0472b4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void BitcodeWriter::writeThinLinkBitcode (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/module">Module</a> &amp; M, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/modulesummaryindex">ModuleSummaryIndex</a> &amp; Index, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a2b53e399f7a71b096a6caef6be6ff12d">ModuleHash</a> &amp; ModHash)</>}>
Write the specified thin link bitcode file (i.e., the minimized bitcode file) to the buffer specified at construction time.

The thin link bitcode file is used for thin link, and it only contains the necessary information for thin link.

ModHash is for use in ThinLTO incremental build, generated while the IR bitcode file writing.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitcode/bitcodewriter-h/#l00100">100</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/bitcode/bitcodewriter-h">BitcodeWriter.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/bitcode/lib/bitcode/writer/bitcodewriter-cpp/#l05559">5559</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/bitcode/lib/bitcode/writer/bitcodewriter-cpp">BitcodeWriter.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
